website_summaries.verdict: Whether it’s playing with a skyscraper-sized Dynamax Pikachu, befriending a fuzzy Wooloo, or battling online, there’s so much for Pokémon trainers to see and do.
pros: 400 Pokémon to catch, trade, train, and battle with
Explore the expansive Gallar region and its massive Wild Area
cons: Many classic species are unobtainable in these games

customer_reviews.title: If you've played the previous 2 generations you'll know what to expect.
customer_reviews.text: It's nothing special. It's OK. Fun for a little while, if a little dull. It's not the awful monstrosity that everyone is making it out to be but it's not a masterpiece by any stretch. I would would say it just barely manages to be mediocre. If half stars were a thing on here I would give it 2.5 stars. Probably shouldn't cost the full $60. This is more of a $45 game. I'd say it earns a firm last place in a ranking of all 8 generations. But hey, it's a Pokemon game. It's missable, but if you don't have anything better to do its probably worth a look.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Be mindful of "reviews" left by the dramatic Hatedom.
customer_reviews.text: The game is an improvement from Sun/Moon and is genuinely the most fun I've had with the pokemon games. Everything about the game is good and the music is fantastic. There is an "issue" of a bunch of pokemon not being in the game, but let's be honest, no game that wasn't the first two gens had every single pokemon (excluding version exclusives of course) unless you transferred them from an older game, and more likely than not it will not affect your enjoyment of this game. It definitely doesn't deserve the review bombing it is getting.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Duncan

customer_reviews.title: No game
customer_reviews.text: Per ordered and three was no cartridge in the case
customer_reviews.author: THoax13

customer_reviews.title: Pre-order items?
customer_reviews.text: I pre-ordered this game but didn't get the special items for doing so. Am I missing something?
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Eubanks

customer_reviews.title: Must have game
customer_reviews.text: I have three children ages 4,6,9 all of them love pokemon I couldn't help but play a little of the game it looks amazing and will make a great Christmas present
customer_reviews.author: Motherducker

customer_reviews.title: So much hate for such an awesome game. Ignore the 1 star snowflake reviews!
customer_reviews.text: I've already sunk 12 hours into this game, and I haven't even made a dent. The map is way more massive than I thought it would be, and I have still only seen about 110 of the 400 pokemon in the game. Animation is beautiful, and I'm quite addicted. Yes it sucks that every previous pokemon didn't make the cut, especially some must haves like bulbasaur and squirtle (wtf guys?) but you just have to get over it , and enjoy it for what it is. A well made, very in depth, delightful game that you will lose hours per sitting in.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Fun, awesome, do it
customer_reviews.text: 1st new Pokémon game I’ve played in probably 15 years, and it’s SO COOL. I think they did a great job with it! Got rid of some of the tedious aspects of the game from silver (I swear I’m not trolling). Fun, worth your time! Pokémon now get experience as long as they are in your party AND you get experience not only when you defeat opponents but also when you catch Pokémon! Pretty vistas, good music, amusing characterizations
customer_reviews.author: Casual Listener

customer_reviews.title: Rushed Game
customer_reviews.text: Game feels unfinished. Many things were left out, the remaining things are not polished either.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb!
customer_reviews.text: As a pokemon player from the original red/blue I was super sceptical, but after hours of gameplay I'm nothing but pleased with this game! Gamefreak did a great job with this one!
customer_reviews.author: hannah neuse

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Pokemon game
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing Pokemon Since Pokemon Red/Blue. This one was a disappointment. Gamefreak seems to have but little to no effort and cut every corner they could. Only reason it gets 2 stars is strictly because its Pokemon. Some of my biggest problems is how exp share works, the lack of content and the cost of 60$ vs every other Pokemon game being 40$ or less. This game is completely overpriced, It is sun and moon with less content and 20$ more.
customer_reviews.author: Med

customer_reviews.title: So much for Gotta catch 'em all
customer_reviews.text: More than half of the national dex was cut from the game for no discernible reason, the animations are lacking, the game holds your hand for way to long and half of the available pokemon are locked behind post game despite not having much to do in the post game (compared to previous games). Overall very disappointed with the way this game turned out, hopefully the next games will be better but it seems unlikely.
customer_reviews.author: crmnvan

customer_reviews.title: This game is great!
customer_reviews.text: People who say they don't like this game are crazy! It's fun, fresh, cute, beautiful, I am enjoying it quite a bit! I wish there were new eeveelutions, it would have been the perfect game for it. And I wish they had the whole national pokedex. All the same, it's a great game and I am enjoying every second of playing it! Its better than sun and moon. Give it a chance!
customer_reviews.author: rika195

customer_reviews.title: I do not recommend buying, I am very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Paid 60 for an unfinished game. Story was very short, a 60 dollar game should offer much more, one of the most complained aspects I have is they did not release all of the pokemon in this game. Not an enjoyable experience, very very subpar. I had a great time in Pokemon Black/White, and Heartgold/Soulsilver, those games were actually amazing, and I would've payed 60 or more for those. This, max I'd pay is 20. I do not recommend, very disappointed in this purchase. Hopefully one day we get another pokemon game that is.... good.
customer_reviews.author: Shivam Patel

customer_reviews.title: The game is great, Amazon is not
customer_reviews.text: Definitely buy this game if you like the franchise, but do not buy from Amazon. I preordered, when I could have easily bought it ten minutes from my house when it released, and now I’m not getting it until the 20th. I pay for prime, and this crap always happens smh. Just get it at Walmart and save yourself the trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A

customer_reviews.title: A solid entry in the series.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t give it five stars because amazon mislabeled my copy and I wound up with sword instead, but I’m a series veteran so I know it’s close enough. It’s a charming Pokémon game with colorful new creatures, a solid array of some of the old guard, and a couple of new gimmicks to keep you entertained. An excellent first Pokémon game, a fun new generation for the veterans who aren’t weary of the mechanics. I’m having a great time!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This is trash. Bad graphics, cut Pokémon and blno challenge. Wait until Gamefreak learns how to make a good game on the Nintendo Switch.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Marin

customer_reviews.title: Great game full of content
customer_reviews.text: This has been one of the few times playing a Pokemon game where I didn't feel like I was just going through the motions. Starting from square one is pretty fun, the graphics on the models are amazing though a few lack luster graphics do stand out but I can't say it breaks the immersion of this kind of game. The wild area with its raid battles are enjoyable online features need polish but aren't requiered to play
customer_reviews.author: Izzy Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Very fun
customer_reviews.text: Really fun and clever Pokémon game from a fan who’s played them all many times starting when they were brand new.
customer_reviews.author: L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Best recent Pokemon game.
customer_reviews.text: It's disappointing that over 450 Pokemon isn't available in the game, especially since I'm not feeling the new designs of the Galar Pokemon, but the gameplay, features and mechanics is vastly better than Let's Go or Sun/Moon. Dynamax is also a better gimmick than Z-Moves and that dancing bs, but not as great as Mega-Evolution. Also not as much hand holding as Sun/Moon.
customer_reviews.author: S.768

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The game is very disappointing. Graphics are not much better than the last 3DS pokemon games. Not all pokemons are included. Not all previous Moves are included. I've played all previous generation Pokemon games before and this is the first one where I'm not likely to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Son B Duong

customer_reviews.title: More of the same
customer_reviews.text: More of the same no voice over animations are the same graphics in pokemon let's go seem better to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Labor of love rushed by Corporate?
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Cool new pokemon designs. Enjoyable characters. Character customization returns. Raid with friends is fun. Trainer card customization. Wild Area is an awesome open world with weather, item gathering, cooking, and nice pokemon animations. For example Mantine jumping in and out of the water. Cons: Lag spikes. Graphical errors with an unpolished feel at times. Raid AI sucks for Solo . Raiding with randoms is poorly optimized. Story makes no sense. Town areas look big but most of it is unexplorable. Turffield and Spikemuth being the biggest offenders. Gigamax is not clearly explained as mostly end only content. For example not all Alcremie can Gigamax.
customer_reviews.author: Sean and Michelle

customer_reviews.title: SwSh is a Poor Effort
customer_reviews.text: This Pokemon game is rushed, shallow, poorly paced, and poorly written. It's towns are made of two buidling's. It has at most 5/7 trainers on any path. Do not buy this game. Wait for the next one.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Coons

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but unfinished.
customer_reviews.text: Before you buy this game you should know that you will never be able to play with more than half the pokemon in the roster, the online gameplay is shoddy rarely ever allowing you to play with your friends who got the game even though you are paying a monthly fee for online, and the graphics while at time beautiful often look completely underwhelming. That being said, when the game works, it's tons of fun. Definitely less gameplay per dollar spent compared to the older games on the DS, but there are a few nice spins in there and the region is beautiful (though the towns are often a joke with how small they are).
customer_reviews.author: Naivety

customer_reviews.title: Costs more for less content
customer_reviews.text: Lowest number of Pokemon in the last decade. Removed features from previous installments. Poor story. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Denny

customer_reviews.title: Love this game for myself and my 8 year old son!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 8 year old LOVED this game and so did I! As kids my brother and I played the original gameboy pokemon games and this is amazing! My son can read very well which is importnant because it is a storyline game with a ton of reading. That is one thing I love about it. The entire game is a blast and even with all the crazy new characters it brought back a lot of nostalgia for me seeing many of the old ones in it! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: ShepherdMomTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect in its execution!
customer_reviews.text: This game was an absolute BLAST from opening sequence to the final fight. Even the endgame arc of the story fits so well with the whole story. If you have a Switch, you need to play this game. It is so much fun. I haven't played any Pokemon since the original Red/Blue/Yellow editions and this was easy to pick up and play through. I still don't have a complete Pokedex in the game but I have beaten the story which allows me to do the rest at my leisure. Again, so much fun!
customer_reviews.author: Peter H.

customer_reviews.title: What Happend Nintendo?
customer_reviews.text: As a Pokemon fan since the early times in the gameboy I must say this is disappointing. Compare the engaging, progressive, and interactive gameplay and characters of Zelda Breath of the Wild, or Mario Odyssey to this excuse of 'new game.' The argument "this is for children" , if you even know Nintendo, does not apply all their other franchises appeal to children and adults alike such as: Mario Kart 8, Fire Emblem, Luigi's Mansion, Super Smash Brothers, all of which were economic as well as gaiming successes. Pokemon is the highest earning Nintendo Franchise, and yet it produces the lowest quality of gameplay. Nostalgic series, archaic gameplay.
customer_reviews.author: Mauro Barradas

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I’m not going to rant. If you’ve read reviews online about incomplete dex, lack of story, etc they’re correct. Pokémon pikachu was a longer game than this. And honestly had a better nap and feel. I recommend you save your money until pricing drops or they release a platinum option. I play it because I might as well get my money’s worth. If you do buy it I recommend bunnelby over the other starters he’s the best move set to match stats. Honestly I shoved my starter in the pc and made a pseudo legendary team I felt no ties to the starters, sorry sobble.
customer_reviews.author: Coyoteduce

customer_reviews.title: Unfinished game.
customer_reviews.text: I'll be a little lenient with my review. This game is actually pretty good even when missing 400 pokemon and all the features blablabla, but the problem is that if you are gonna miss that many things from a AAA pokemon game you should at least polish it so that the rough edges are not as noticeable.. They didn't. They did focus on the competitive aspect reason why I bought this game but the general story, animations and some sounds are messed up. I hope that Game Freak releases a second game with up to date animations and more pokemon so that we can be satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Escanor

customer_reviews.title: Lazy Developers
customer_reviews.text: The game has hardly any improvement from the previous 3DS games. There's a heavily reduced amount of content with a lazy story and annoying/boring characters. Barebones online functionality. Little to no replay value outside of playing competitively with friends.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Cute but a bit boring and repetitive
customer_reviews.text: I didn't end up finishing this game. There's just not enough going on with it to keep my attention long term. It is very cute and the production value is high. But there just isn't enough variety to the game. You walk forward, fight pokeman, and then repeat. It's hours and hours of just walking forward and fighting pokeman. The battle system isn't deep or complex or satisfying enough for the entire game to stand on it. And the world doesn't have enough going on to make up the difference. The open world areas are small and again there's nothing to do in them expect fight Pokémon. Overall this game just isn't for me.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great game despite harsh reviews
customer_reviews.text: I've had so much fun with Pokemon Shield. It's a bit different from past Pikemon games and does not include a national dex, but I don't believe that inhibits play. The Wild Area is by far my favorite addition to this game, as it's so easy to spend a couple hours (or longer) riding around catching Pokemon, collecting ingredients and interacting with other players. This game allows you to find more pokemon evolutions in the wild than previous games, and even things like Gyrados, Milotic, and eveelutions pop up in the overworld. If you're hesitating to buy this game, I say just go for it. I'm so happy I bought it, and I've put in over 85 hours so far.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: Super fun, ignore the haters!
customer_reviews.text: I am a 26 year old and I have been playing Pokemon since the first generation. I almost gave up with the previous gen (Sun/Moon), but this newest gen gives me hope for the future of Pokemon! I'm glad I ignored all the criticism floating out there. This game was lots of fun!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Graphics look great and the Pokémon are super cute. Another great installment to the series.
customer_reviews.author: Justice_Nugget

customer_reviews.title: It’s a great game to play with your kids or on your own.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been a fan of Pokémon nor did I know anything about Pokémon before my kid all of a sudden started to show an interest in Pokémon about a year ago. My kid & I both love this game. This is the first Pokémon game we’ve ever played so we had to start off without having any of the Pokémon characters from previous games. We love the game play and enjoy being able to load our Pokédex with lots of characters. It kinda sucks that you have to purchase the expansion pack to get access to The Isle of Armor and The Crown Tundra. Other than that, it’s a great game and I recommend it to all Pokémon fans.
customer_reviews.author: Chamuco

customer_reviews.title: Terrible game
customer_reviews.text: Massive issues with catching pokemon in this version. Worst title to date in the pokemon franchise. Also tons of combat imbalance in this game. Were the devs high when they coded this stuff?
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Overall good game with a few painful flaws
customer_reviews.text: They did a lot of things with the world and mechanics that i am enjoying more than i thought i would, but every now and then the character models, animations, or inconsistent environment resolutions will jump out at me and throw me out of the moment. It’s really sad and frustrating, but doesn’t ruin my enjoyment overall, just kinda dampens it. I also am sad that i really don’t care for what ‘storyline’ there is, or taking down the league, or any of the characters. I just want to unlock the map so i can explore more freely.
customer_reviews.author: otterb0t

customer_reviews.title: Low framerate, unplayable
customer_reviews.text: I hate to say this but the game is unplayable on my switch, it lags with low fps every 5 seconds or so. I'm disappointed. It seems cute overall but I can't stand the lag. My switch or the game itself, or both are not working well together. I don't even know what to do, return it and lose all 10 of my precious Pokémon in the process? Pay for Pokémon bank and transfer them? Do I need to call Nintendo and ask them for a replacement game or console??? Ugh this situation is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Nonbinary Intactivist, Hope 4 SavingSons

customer_reviews.title: Coming from a Serious Fan - Not Worth it
customer_reviews.text: While there was a lot of controversy surrounding this game, I was still excited to pre-order it. Unfortunately, that excitement faded quickly. And by quickly, I mean after a few hours of gameplay. I also finished this game within 20 hours and there is hardly any post-game to enjoy (Like the other reviewers mention, the Battle Tower is a far cry from the Battle Frontier and the post-game story lasts for only an hour). For $60, I was expecting much more (GTS, Mega Evolutions, post-game content, better animations, etc). Long story short, it's easily one of the worst Pokemon games. Still decent compared to most games, but not up there with the other mainstream games.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: If you like Pokémon, you won't be sad!
customer_reviews.text: Was pre-ordered, delivered early on release day, and has been fun. New pokemon to learn and play with has been a great blast, don't let the hate scare you away.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome game so far! Came fast!
customer_reviews.text: Good thing I preorder it because it came fast which is awesome. Also, i love the game so far. Love the graphics and love that it's on the Switch now.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Pokémon a hit with its target audience.
customer_reviews.text: I’m afraid that I have never played Pokémon, and I doubt that I ever shall. Thus, the method I’ll use for evaluating it won’t be based on its graphics, characters, or playability. However, I am a grandfather. I purchased this game for my teenaged grandson this Christmas, and was there when he unwrapped it. If I can evaluate a product based on the joyful response of the recipient, then the Pokémon franchise has a major success on its hands yet again.
customer_reviews.author: Portista

customer_reviews.title: Should Be Great for Casual, Fun, Gaming
customer_reviews.text: Arrived safely. It's a Christmas gift. My 20 year old son has always bought all the Pokemon games. He read reviews prior to wanting this one and stated that he only casually plays on the Switch, so this game will be fine and fun for him even though the hardcore, younger, gamers are overly critical of this game.
customer_reviews.author: nitroburn1972

customer_reviews.title: The wild area is great. It's basically a better version of the safari zone
customer_reviews.text: I've played every Pokémon version game. This was the first to be on a TV console and it was disappointing. Graphics are good. Story was the same old but on a bigger console this game could have done a lot more. There's basically no post game. This game is basically a 3ds game on the switch but it's $20 more expensive because it's on the switch. Animation sucked especially for a switch game. But if you like Pokémon then get this game but don't expect anything awe inspiring.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, unopened condition.
customer_reviews.text: My son was very excited to receive this as a birthday gift. He has been playing it as much as I will let him. He is seven, so keep that in mind. The game itself provides a lot of hints and assistance and I do not think it is very challenging, so it may not be as interesting to older switch players. One other thing that some may be disappointed with is there are a lot of Pokémon favorites not included. My son however has paid no attention to this aspect so it was a great purchase for our family! The graphics in the game are great!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsieb

customer_reviews.title: Fun at first, but it wears off after about gym 3...
customer_reviews.text: I did have a fun time playing this game for a while, and it has some good additions to the series like the wild area, but overall it felt incomplete and rushed. The lack of older pokemon is awful. The story had pretty bad pacing. They removed the global trade system. Yeah, it looks very nice, but it's down there with my least favorites in the series.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Countiss

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This game is very entertaining. Have been waiting for a Pokémon game on a console for years! Love it despite the bad reviews
customer_reviews.author: Demesio

customer_reviews.title: Lazy developers
customer_reviews.text: Shows many signs of cutting corners and little effort put into it. the game was said to leave out several pokemon so they could work on the animations only to see the animations were copied from previous generations, i do not appreciate being lied to, in addition the dialogue is generic and could have been so much better but instead they took the quick cash grab approach. shame on them!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Intro Pokemon Game
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my girlfriend who had never had a Pokemon game of her own growing up. She immediately fell in love with most of the cute creatures, and sped all the way through to the end. I've heard that some of the veteran players have some legitimate gripes with this iteration, but for a beginner it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Not like old Pokémon games.
customer_reviews.text: As someone who grew up playing Pokémon on my DS and then on my WII, I was looking for a little nostalgia gaming. This game did not live up to my expectations. First, it’s not open world... every next step is told to you. Very linear. Second, I wasn’t excited by the new Pokémon and the fighting animations are lacking. For a hardcore Pokémon fan who knows what they are getting into, this game might be fun. For me, I was disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sean T.

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable, but don’t ignore its flaws.
customer_reviews.text: Far from perfect, but an still enjoyable addition to the series. This was the first Pokémon game I’ve played since Gen V, so the story was disappointingly short. As well, the wild area turns into a frame dropping mess when connected to online. Speaking of the online, it doesn’t work very well. With raids, unless you’ve already got a code and a set group of friends playing with you, you will rarely if ever come across other players to join in your raids. Finally, the 20 minute battle timer on VS matches is dumb and promotes stalling. Hopefully these expansions fix this stuff and expand the main story.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah

customer_reviews.title: Great family game
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I can complain about is they sent me sword instead of shield. However I can’t say enough about how great this Pokémon game is and how much I like it. My family from 6-14 love it. I’m going on 30 and love it. It’s a must own if you own a switch and love Pokémon.
customer_reviews.author: Derek T

customer_reviews.title: Gotta catch ‘em all...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great semi-reboot of the franchise. While not perfect, they’ve done allot of things right here. Most notable, in my eyes, are the improvements that removed most, if not all of the barriers and hardships-of-entry into competitive battling. Mints... yes! My biggest, most genuine complaint... the online component of Max Raid battles. Good grief. Exploits and selfishness are rampant.
customer_reviews.author: ShyGuy

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: This game has been a nice refreshing breath of fresh air all wrapped up in a familiar story line with recognizable friends. It is a game that I can give to my 8 year old or can enjoy myself and get equal enjoyment. I am really glad that we have Pokemon Shield and I can't wait to catch em all!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle S.

customer_reviews.title: Lovin' this new generation of pkm!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on estimated time of arrival, & package came in perfect shape as always! Now this game is very different from the previous pokemon games. But the new features are very easy to learn. In fact, this game tends to hold your hand through it. Which some may find annoying, but I didn't mind it too much. If you're a new to Pokemon or a veteran I believe its worth getting cause there's something for everyone. Its a whole new region, with fresh faces, Pokemon, mechanics. And just really quite fun overall!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Just simply fun...
customer_reviews.text: Great fun for my kids. This was their first Pokemon game and they have been having a blast, especially in the Wild Area. The Wild Area let's you battle together with other trainers to take down gigantic Pokemon. I have been playing Pokemon for 20 years and while the game is really simple for veteran players it's still enjoyable. The Wild Area is definitely the best feature.
customer_reviews.author: LogicalLizard

customer_reviews.title: It's Pokemon. The Good and the Bad.
customer_reviews.text: For the first iteration of Pokemon on consoles it's OK. What the series needs is a drastic remodeling from the ground up. I didn't care to finish my run through the game as it the same experience you may have had almost 10 times over at this point. The console is supposed to allow for more technical freedoms and The Pokemon Company didn't really take advantage of any of that.
customer_reviews.author: Seraph

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I am a 69 yr old grandma and have been playing Nintendo games since my kids where little, now I'm playing the same games as the grandsons on the switch. I have really enjoyed this game would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broken promise to autistic adult. I went through hell!
customer_reviews.text: My 33-year-old autistic daughter ordered this in June and was promisedA golden backpack as a gift it didn’t arrive on the day it was supposed to I had to deal with an autistic child that was looking forward to something counting the months the weeks the days the hours the minutes the seconds when it finally arrived there was nothing to retrieve the backpack. So sorry please expedite her free gift. Chasing UPS trucks all over town And I truly cannot have this happen again. With my daughter I need plenty of notice for something like this
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Possibly used or a return
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a Christmas gift for my daughter. Case was halfway open and cartridge was loose inside. Very disappointed, Amazon. I'd like to give my child a new item instead of one that's probably already been returned.
customer_reviews.author: Skunkape78

customer_reviews.title: A Good Evolution of Pokémon
customer_reviews.text: This game is fun. It doesn’t shake up the Pokémon formula in a big way. But, it has a lot of improvements. No more random encounters, you can play on a TV without additional hardware, and the gyms vary depending on what version you’re playing. Some of the new Pokémon designs are good, others are kind of meh. The Dynamax forms are impressive visually, but otherwise they’re pretty similar to Mega Evolution. I also love being able to adjust the camera in open areas, but I hate that you can’t anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Story

customer_reviews.title: Fine this version of Pokemon a little more challenging
customer_reviews.text: For Me Growing up watching Pokemon on TV, playing the games on the Game Boy,Nintendo DS,3D's and now the Nintendo Switch. I found this game a little bit more challenging than what I was used to. I feel very please that I always had a strategy guide with me in learning the new land. I am looking forward to seeing how they are going to do the new Pokémon Journeys: the Series TV Show in US.
customer_reviews.author: Matlock2012

customer_reviews.title: Almost a 1 Star.
customer_reviews.text: The game is underwhelming in every sense, weak visuals are the first bad sign, then comes a boring story, a gimmick for the battles that feels forced, and the Pokémon animations and models who haven’t been updated or retouched in any way. The worst offender is not having the complete catalogue of creatures at your disposal, that severely hinders any true strategic value previous iterations in the franchise had. Oh! And the customization options for the playable character are few and ugly. This game needs to stop trying to hard to impress and stick to the magic formula they already perfected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long time fan
customer_reviews.text: Been a fan of Pokemon since before the original red/blue. Excellent game, just wish they'd make one that would incorporate all the regions and Pokemon in one game.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and well thought out game!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love the newest addition to the Pokemon Franchise. I feel that it combines all the best parts about the previous games to make for one beautifully designed version. The graphics are gorgeous and they've come such a long way from the beginning!
customer_reviews.author: A-mommy-ymous

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT as shown in pic. It is UK version
customer_reviews.text: The picture shown in the listing is the US version rated E for everyone. What you receive is the UK version rated 7. UK restricts content for video games the US allows. Disappointed if I wanted the UK version there are several sellers who sell the 7 rated UK version for much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Ratchet

customer_reviews.title: Polished, fun game
customer_reviews.text: It's a Pokemon game so it follows the usual template for that but the zones and story telling are beautiful and the way you interact with game mechanics is improved and polished and really intuitive/nice.
customer_reviews.author: KTM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for kids. Limited open world.
customer_reviews.text: Many people have complained that this game isn’t truly open world like Zelda breath of the wild. Please remember this game is for kids as well, and having a game that complicated would alienate most of game freaks target audience. Maybe we will get an adult version someday that’s super in-depth, but for my kids this is really fun.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.text: Got this and a switch during quarantine and I love it. This is the best pokemon game I’ve played and I’ve been playing since yellow. This is how I’ve always wanted the game to be! Only complaint is that I really miss the global trade but the surprise trade is still fun and really helps you build the pokedex and get rare Pokemon
customer_reviews.author: Julius

customer_reviews.title: Another Pokemon Installment - Kids love the game.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for Pokémon Shield - Nintendo Switch Kids love this game, no issues or problems with the order. We have been finding that we purchase more and more switch games via Amazon vs local retailers. No more showing up at the local shop only to find out they're sold out of whatever game you wanted.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend to buy this game
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best Pokémon game to ever exist I’m blown away how this game really brought Pokemon to life. You feel like your own a true Pokemon adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Adlai Timothy  Banks

customer_reviews.title: Quick Shipping
customer_reviews.text: My oldest daughter absolutely loves Pokémon. She almost lost her mind when she got it. That was enough for me. She was so happy. It arrived very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: lionfamlee5

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun game to play. It has a great storyline, cool Pokemon (though I actually think they could have used more interesting ones) and great graphics. It's a long campaign and has even more once you've finished the initial story. It has a great exploratory dynamic too. Highly recommend. You gotta catch them all!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Oi, it’s a Pokémon!
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. I love the features, I love the graphics, I love Pokémon! This one has Galarian Ponyta so I can live a good life. Just buy it. You’ll love it.
customer_reviews.author: FoxyDomingo

customer_reviews.title: A decent game
customer_reviews.text: I think the game is a good but it lacks a good story and the rival is too plain. The overworld looks beautiful but there are some details that looks out of place. Towns are a lot smaller and not many interactions. The game is super short but I do have fun doing the raids and the online battles are fun. Overall it’s a decent game and it could have been a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Good game, good graphics, good features
customer_reviews.text: Bought Pokemkn Shield and the Switch to bring back some nostalgia of the good old days. As a PC gamer, I can tell you that the graphics of this game are REALLY good for the Switch.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Series going downhill.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. What happened to these games? You can beat it with one pokemon without even trying. You win every battle by hitting A over and over. How boring.
customer_reviews.author: Jermane

customer_reviews.title: Not Overrated
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot more content to be had in this game than previous versions (where you would just restart or muddle around in the post game) and the online content is entertaining all the way through your adventure. Thankfully, any Pokemon you catch post game don't suffer from being under-leveled and many mechanics are expedited so as to remain as fresh as possible. Overall, even though it seemed like it would be rough from the get-go, it was a gratifying pokemon experience and a great foray into the main console generations.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy B.

customer_reviews.title: Lacking but still fun
customer_reviews.text: I actually ended up really liking this game. Cool regionals, nice gyms, love Grimmsnarl the most~ It's fun and, while I do miss my pokemon, I was cool with what they had to offer here. It'd be better if there weren't version exclusives on top of missing pokemon. If it were one or the other, that would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Eletha Gilcyne

customer_reviews.title: Great game. No preorder bonuses.
customer_reviews.text: The game is fun I preordered shield but I have not yet received the preorder 10$ Amazon credit or the in game golden Amazon bag that was included in the preorder bonus.. it's the whole reason I preordered or else I would have waited a few weeks instead. I really hope I receive the bonuses as it was clearly stated to be included.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Not Well-Polished
customer_reviews.text: As popularly indicated, this game feels somewhat unpolished for a "next step" for Pokemon games, and certainly feels unpolished for a full retail Switch game. The online is particularly janky, which is disappointing considering the fee for Nintendo Online. It's a fun and serviceable Pokemon game, and the new creatures are a delight. If you're looking for "a Pokemon game", that's what you're getting. If you're looking "the next Pokemon game", this falls short.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Rubi III

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Pokémon Game to the legacy minus the weird new pokemon
customer_reviews.text: Great to come back to the nostalgia of Pokémon. I got over some of the horribly un creative new Pokémon and made a party of the classics minus Scorbunny which was to cool.
customer_reviews.author: Van Brehm

customer_reviews.title: Great update to the series
customer_reviews.text: Best Pokemon game I've played since diamond and pearl. Good selection of pokemon that can be caught in game. So far I haven't really come across any villains which is a bummer. I enjoyed facing team rocket, team magma, and team aqua in the past. There's a new feature where all pokemon get a share of experience from catching pokemon, and from battles. Welcome feature.
customer_reviews.author: BklynTech

customer_reviews.title: 3 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Terrible graphics, way too easy, and some extremely stupid story elements (such as the unbearably pathetic rival, Hop), but is somehow still extremely fun.
customer_reviews.author: KiryuDojima

customer_reviews.title: Not as bad as people are saying...
customer_reviews.text: My kiddo loves this game. I’ve been hearing a lot of complaints about this game and while mostly true, they don’t detract from the game that much. Really, very few of the 1* reviews are verified purchases...they’re mostly from haters who are just coming on to Amazon to complain and downvote the game.
customer_reviews.author: astarre

customer_reviews.title: haven't play a pokemon game since pearl and diamond
customer_reviews.text: Good old similar gameplay but it missed lots of my favorite pokemon. Loved how the way pokemon encounter works. However, I wish the game has voice acting.
customer_reviews.author: cho

customer_reviews.title: The most solid Pokemon game to date
customer_reviews.text: This is the most solid Pokemon game to date. It’s all the things you love about Pokemon, but crisper, cleaner, more refined, and—for the first time—on the big screen. I put 60 hours into it in the first seven days following my purchase. I’ve now put 100 hours into it and I still have 110/400 Pokemon left to catch. This game is great for Pokemon fans and newcomers alike. I hope I’ve talked someone into buying this game, because you won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Not Perfect, But Fun
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, the game does have some issues, but it's not nearly as awful as all the pre-release controversies made it sound. I've had a lot of fun playing so far, and while I do agree with some issues raised by others, some of the points people bring up are a bit subjective. It does suck that the dex was cut, but it's also made completing everything so much less of a hassle and/or overwhelming. The story is pretty weak, but there are fun characters with good designs. There's also a decent amount of new Pokemon with cool designs. tl;dr It's a fun game, but nowhere near perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still a fun Pokemon game
customer_reviews.text: New features for a Pokemon game make it fun for newcomers and old fans alike. It's easier than the originals, but there are still challenges.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great game bad shipping buy from Nintendo!
customer_reviews.text: Not the games fault Pokémon is my favorite even if the story/characters are bad SwSh brings Pokémon to a whole new level including regional variants, new dex, G-maxing, and dlc content look amazing what makes me rate this so low is the shipping legit my package has been sitting somewhere in Al which is like an hour away from me If I don’t get it today I want my refund please My switch is arriving to me today I hope to play it soon
customer_reviews.author: ArtsInInk from ADrive Army

customer_reviews.title: It is a Pokémon game (no really)
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people were expecting more but this is just straight up a “mobile” Pokémon game like the ones in the Gameboy and DS. The story is similar to the rest of the games and the gameplay with a few gimmicks. The only real complaint I have is they should release Pokémon home in launch day and the full National Pokédex. Overall the gameplay is great, The music is Fantastic and the story is okay.
customer_reviews.author: ModernZombie1

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed after I finished.
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed after I beat this game. This is not 60 dollars worth of game. GAMEFREAK certinly got enough people to believe their lies about how hard they worked on this game. Pokemon Tournament was miles past these graphics and this game took me 12 hours to beat. Your paying for the pokemon name, This game is 10$ cheaper at Walmart, And you don't have to wait for it.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody

customer_reviews.title: Super Fun Game!
customer_reviews.text: Hours of play time with this game! Great for being shut in right now.
customer_reviews.author: MD Ron

customer_reviews.title: It's Pokemon but updated and I like it a lot.
customer_reviews.text: Feels like a very natural evolution to the Pokemon franchise. I bought sword for my nephew and shield for myself. Nothing to complain about except that I haven't caught a Lucario and that was the 3rd Pokemon my nephew caught and he refuses to trade or breed one for me.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: A 100+ Hour review
customer_reviews.text: I think it’s a alright Pokémon game, sure I could complain over the flaws the game has but after playing the game for over 100+ hours, I don’t really mind it. The battles are crazy good with the exception of choice items during the dynamaxing but they usually are dealt with quick with/without dynamaxing. But the battle animations are somewhat terrible for the most part then made up with some of the legendary special moves being a blast. Yeah good for Pokémon fans alike old and new. Especially newcomers wanting to be apart of the experience that Pokémon go doesn’t really have.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Leon

customer_reviews.title: Good, not the best. Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: This game was good. The story was a bit simple. Usually Game Freak tries to be a bit more intricate with the plot of their games. I would highly recommend this to a younger gamer trying out pokemon for the first time. Sun and Moon are currently my favourite.
customer_reviews.author: k.smalls

customer_reviews.title: Wooloo aren’t the only sheep for this game
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of sheep jumping on a hate bandwagon for this game. The game was really enjoyable and cute. I love the new music and characters. Most of the one stars are sheep who are upset about the national dex being removed, but as I wasn’t planning on catching 1000+ Pokémon anyways, it doesn’t bother me. There are some unfinished looking animations and it gets laggy in the Wild area, especially when online. I’ll say it’s not worth the $60 price tag but if you ever catch it on sale, you should give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Title
customer_reviews.text: Pokemon games were getting stale. They tried to throw in some weird mechanics and didn't draw in my attention. This game has an open world mechanic where your just starting and you'll see fully evolved Pokemon. Seeing some of your favorites walk around is so amazing! Makes it seem more like how the world of Pokemon would actually be!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Raids are therapy
customer_reviews.text: Definitely on the quest to getting shiny Pokémon at this point. I don’t know why doing the raids are so therapeutic but I find it relaxing.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Tremblay

product_meta.title: Pokémon Shield - Nintendo Switch
product_meta.description: Platform:Nintendo Switch| Edition:ShieldA new generation of Pokémon is coming to the Nintendo Switch system. Become a Pokémon Trainer, embark on a new journey in the new Galar region, and unravel the mystery behind the Legendary Pokémon Zacian and Zamazenta! Explore the Wild Area, a vast expanse of land where the player can freely control the camera. And participate in Max Raid Battles*** in which players will face off against gigantic and super-strong Pokémon known as Dynamax Pokémon. Begin your adventure by choosing one of three new partner Pokémon: Grookey, Scorbunny, or Sobble and encounter new and familiar Pokémon as you catch, battle, and trade. Players can control the camera and explore the vast areas around them in the Wild Area. Team up with other players locally or online in the new multiplayer co-op Max Raid Battles. Trainers who possess the special item Dynamax Band can Dynamax their own Pokémon. Get ready for the next Pokémon adventure in the Pokémon Sword and Pokémon Shield games. If you don’t already have a Nintendo Switch Online membership, you can try it out with a free 7-day trial. Don't worry if you already activated a previous free trial— an additional seven-day free trial is now available. Nintendo Switch Online membership and Nintendo Account required for online features. Free trial automatically converts to 1-month auto-renewing membership unless automatic renewal is turned off by the end of the free trial. Credit card/PayPal account required for 18+. Free trial cannot be redeemed by a Nintendo Account with an active Individual Membership or Family Membership. Not available in all countries. Internet access required for online features. Terms apply. *Additional games and systems may be required; sold separately. **Nintendo Switch Online membership (sold separately) and Nintendo Account required for online play. Not available in all countries. Internet access required for online features. Terms apply. *** An internet connection is required to receive the special Meowth.
feature_bullets: Catch, battle, and trade Pokémon on an all-new adventure in the Galar region
Choose from three new partner Pokémon and encounter never-before-seen Pokémon
Unravel the mystery behind the Legendary Pokémon Zacian and Zamazenta!
Team up with other Trainers to participate in Max Raid Battles***!
Battle wild Dynamax Pokémon in Max Raid Battles and try catching them***

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars9,440 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
